soc.robot

Interface SOCBuildPlan

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SOCBuildPlanStack

    public interface SOCBuildPlan
    Encapsulation for building plans of SOCPossiblePieces. Typically implemented as SOCBuildPlanStack; a third-party bot might have a different implementation.

    Before v2.4.50, Building Plans were represented as Stack<SOCPossiblePiece>.

    Since:
    2.4.50
    Author:
    kho30

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Reset the build plan

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Is this plan currently empty?
        Returns:
        true if nothing is currently planned

      • getPlannedPiece

        SOCPossiblePiece getPlannedPiece(int pieceNum)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Get the ith planned build item, without removing it from the plan. This is typically called with an index of 0 (the first piece, equivalent to a peek), however it is called with an index of 1 during the play of a Road Building card.

        Note: This may be unsafe - assumes an appropriate size of build plan. Could easily add a check for size in the function call, but it's probably easier to debug for now with bad calls throwing exceptions, rather than returning nulls that may be harder to figure out if they create funny behavior later. JSettlers building plans used to be Stack, which throws an exception rather than returning null.

        In future, non-linear build plans should be discussed as to how to implement this. For example if we traverse a tree-like structure, so separate functions would need to be added to switch between branches.

        Parameters:
        pieceNum - Piece number within plan, where 0 is the first to be built. Range is 0 to getPlanDepth() - 1.
        Returns:
        Piece within plan
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if pieceNum is out of range
        See Also:
        advancePlan()

      • getPlanDepth

        int getPlanDepth()
        Return the depth of the plan: The number of pieces to be built. Non-linear plans to be discussed in future.
        Returns:
        Number of pieces in this plan
        See Also:
        getPlannedPiece(int)

      • advancePlan

        SOCPossiblePiece advancePlan()
                      throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Step forward in the plan. Equivalent to a pop in the stack implementation.
        Returns:
        the piece at index 0 in the plan
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if isEmpty()
        See Also:
        getPlannedPiece(int)

      • getFirstPieceResources

        SOCResourceSet getFirstPieceResources()
        Get the resources needed to build the first piece in this plan.
        Returns:
        getPlannedPiece(0).getResourcesToBuild(), or SOCResourceSet.EMPTY_SET if that's null or if isEmpty()

      • getTotalResourcesForBuildPlan

        SOCResourceSet getTotalResourcesForBuildPlan()
        Calculate the total resources needed to build all pieces in this plan.
        Returns:
        Total resources, from each piece's SOCPossiblePiece.getResourcesToBuild()
